content.question:
At a certain height, a tree trunk has a circular cross section. The radius R(t) of that cross section grows at a rate modeled by the function

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>R</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4760@</annotation> </semantics> </math> centimeters per year 

for 0 ≤ t ≤ 3, where time t is measured in years. At time t = 0, the radius is 6 centimeters. The area of the cross section at time t is denoted by A(t).

(a) Write an expression, involving an integral, for the radius R(t) for 0 ≤ t ≤ 3. Use your expression to find R(3).

frqParts.text:
At a certain height, a tree trunk has a circular cross section. The radius R(t) of that cross section grows at a rate modeled by the function

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>R</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4760@</annotation> </semantics> </math> centimeters per year 

for 0 ≤ t ≤ 3, where time t is measured in years. At time t = 0, the radius is 6 centimeters. The area of the cross section at time t is denoted by A(t).

(a) Write an expression, involving an integral, for the radius R(t) for 0 ≤ t ≤ 3. Use your expression to find R(3).
(b) Find the rate at which the cross-sectional area A(t) is increasing at time t = 3 years. Indicate units of measure.

(c) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F70@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using appropriate units, interpret the meaning of that integral in terms of cross-sectional area.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
